article.headline: Portland State 89, Montana 78
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Seamus Boxley and Antone Jarrell each scored 16 points to lead Portland State to an 89-78 victory over Montana on Saturday night. Will Funn added 15 points and 10 assists for the Vikings (7-8, 1-1 Big Sky) while Blake Walker had 14 points. Boxley also grabbed a team-high 14 rebounds. Kevin Criswell led Montana (4-10, 1-1) with 20 points and Steve Horne added 15. Leading 43-35 at halftime, Portland State opened the second half with an 11-0 run and led 54-35 when Marshall Hartman hit a jumper from the corner. The Grizzlies missed their first seven shots of the second half and did not score until Victor Venters connected on a turnaround jumper with 15 minutes remaining. Montana, which trailed by as many as 21 points in the second half, closed the gap late in the game but could get no closer than eight points. Portland State shot 52 percent for the game while Montana shot 44 percent. The Vikings, who outscored Montana 42-20 in the paint, also out-rebounded the Grizzlies 39-29.
